column4: Ubuntu arbitarily stopped mounting my two other internal hard drives, I previously simply mounted them with an NTFS-config program, I haven't even access these drives in the span of when this problem occurred, I checked fstab and it looked fine.
Which ntfs program...
Ntfs-3g
HAve you scanned them from the windows side?
Anything?
HAve you scanned them from the windows side?
what do you mean
You have ntfs  do you also have a windows install on there or why do you have ntfs?
Yes, I also have windows, but it's on an entirely different physical disk, it uses NTFS, and I can't access it anymore, ubuntu can
Ubuntu can't mount is
Windows cant load or mount it and ubuntu cant load or mount it... correct.
Windows can load it and/or mount it.
So why cant you run windows and scan the ntfs disk that is a problem in ubuntu
I don't understand what you're trying to tell me, I want ubuntu to be able to access my drives, Windows has no problem.
I assume that this worked at some point and now it will not...   Sorry I cant be of any help to you
I has worked <_<
sudo fdisk -l | grep NTFS /dev/sda1   *           1        9725    78116031    7  HPFS/NTFS /dev/sdb1   *           1       19457   156288321    7  HPFS/NTFS
As you can see it can see my drives, I don't know how they can't automatically mount....
You can force mount it but there is a reason it wont mount as normal...  Which is why I suggested you run windows diagnostics on it..
How do I forcibly mount them?
Read this first...   http://ubuntuforums.org/showthread.php?t=237754
I personally do not recommend people use ntfs-3g although it seems to work for many people...
Then what would you recommend?
I keep a fat32 as I dont keep files over 4 gig on my system
